definition: to give up
(final particle, same as 吧)
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: But she had come this far, she wasn't going to back out now.
sentences.chinese: 不过既然大老远跑来，绝不会此刻罢手。

sentences.english: Eg. She'd never have stopped tiII she got what she wanted.
sentences.chinese: 因为她不得到自己想要的东西是不会罢手的。

sentences.english: Eg. We will never stop until the experiment succeeds.
sentences.chinese: 试验不成功，我们决不罢手。
但金里奇并未因此罢手。

definition: to give up/to abandon (a goal etc)/to let sth go/forget it/let the matter drop
to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
to stop/to pull back
to rest/to take a break
both sides suffer (idiom)/neither side wins
to concede/to admit defeat
to wait helplessly for death (idiom)/to resign oneself to extinction
to kill to the last one (idiom)/to exterminate/to eradicate/ruthless
to drop (subject etc)
hands tied and waiting to be captured
to give up/to admit failure/to drop the matter/to reconcile oneself to loss/to have no more illusions about
to be willing to/to resign oneself to
to fight to one's last gasp
to let matters rest
see 撕破臉|撕破脸[si1 po4 lian3]
to push sb too far/to go too far (in oppressing people)
